meanings.definition: To deceive or trick someone by creating a false story or situation.
meanings.sent1: She was hoaxing her friends with a made-up ghost story.
meanings.sent2: The prankster was caught hoaxing his classmates with a fake spider.
meanings.sent3: The kids were hoaxing each other with silly jokes at the sleepover.
meanings.sent4: His plan of hoaxing the teacher into believing he was sick backfired.
meanings.sent5: The magician was hoaxing the audience with his disappearing act.

meanings.definition: The act of perpetrating a hoax.
meanings.sent1: The hoaxing of the alien invasion was revealed as a prank.
meanings.sent2: Many people fell for the hoaxing of the Loch Ness Monster sighting.
meanings.sent3: The hoaxing of the missing cookies turned out to be a setup by the siblings.
meanings.sent4: The political scandal involved the hoaxing of important documents.
meanings.sent5: The hoaxing of the treasure map led the adventurers on a wild goose chase.
